page.title: 10Housing in Clive
page.content: Clive is a very attractive village with a population of about 500 people, situated on the south-western side of the Grinshill. The style of housing varies greatly. Many houses were built about 200-300 years ago and are grouped together in the older area of the village. These house are usually made out of red or cream sandstone or red brick and many have a pebble dash exterior. Roofs are usually made from grey slate and the buildings often have sash windows. The newer houses in Clive are made from red brick and have tiled roofs with metal or wooden windows frames, many with double glazing. Most houses have large gardens and at least one garage.Most are detached or semi-detached. Clive Hall in the main street of the village has 16th century herringbone bricks covered with rendering.
